ai-mn14:0.2_0: The Shorter Discourse on the Mass of Suffering
ai-mn14:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying among the Sakyans near Kapilavatthu in Banyan Tree Monastery.
ai-mn14:2.1_0: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha,
ai-mn14:2.2_0: “For a long time I understand the Buddha’s teaching,
ai-mn14:2.3_0: ‘Greed, hate, and delusion are corruptions of the mind.’
ai-mn14:2.4_0: This is how I understand the Buddha’s teaching:
ai-mn14:2.5_0: ‘Greed, hate, and delusion are corruptions of the mind.’
ai-mn14:2.6_0: Despite understanding this, sometimes my mind is occupied by thoughts of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-mn14:2.8_0: I wonder what qualities remain in me that I have such thoughts?”
ai-mn14:3.1_0: “Mahānāma, there is a quality that remains in you that makes you have such thoughts.
ai-mn14:3.2_0: For if you had given up that quality you would not still be living at home and enjoying sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:3.3_0: But because you haven’t given up that quality you are still living at home and enjoying sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:4.1_0: Sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-mn14:4.2_0: Even though a noble disciple has clearly seen this with right wisdom, so long as they don’t achieve the rapture and bliss that are apart from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities, or something even more peaceful than that,
ai-mn14:4.3_0: they might still return to sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:4.4_0: But when they do achieve that rapture and bliss, or something more peaceful than that,
ai-mn14:4.5_0: they will not return to sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:5.1_0: Before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I too clearly saw with right wisdom that:
ai-mn14:5.2_0: ‘Sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.’
ai-mn14:5.3_0: But so long as I didn’t achieve the rapture and bliss that are apart from sensual pleasures and unskillful qualities, or something even more peaceful than that,
ai-mn14:5.4_0: I didn’t announce that I would not return to sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:5.5_0: But when I did achieve that rapture and bliss, or something more peaceful than that,
ai-mn14:5.6_0: I announced that I would not return to sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:6.1_0: And what is the gratification of sensual pleasures?
ai-mn14:6.2_0: There are these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-mn14:6.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by five?
ai-mn14:6.4_0: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-mn14:6.5_0: There are sounds known by the ear ...
ai-mn14:6.8_0: touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
ai-mn14:6.9_0: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-mn14:6.10_0: The pleasure and happiness that arise from these five kinds of sensual stimulation: this is the gratification of sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:6.11_0: this is the gratification of sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:7.1_0: And what is the drawback of sensual pleasures?
ai-mn14:7.2_0: It’s when a gentleman earns a living by means such as
ai-mn14:7.3_0: computing, accounting, calculating, farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or one of the professions.
ai-mn14:7.4_0: Eat, hunger, and thirst, defecation of flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles.
ai-mn14:7.5_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:8.1_0: That gentleman might try hard, strive, and make an effort, but fail to earn any money.
ai-mn14:8.2_0: If this happens, they sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion, saying: ‘Oh, my hard work is wasted. My efforts are fruitless!’
ai-mn14:8.3_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:9.1_0: That gentleman might try hard, strive, and make an effort, and succeed in earning money.
ai-mn14:9.2_0: But their wealth experiences pain and sadness. They experience pleasure and pain.
ai-mn14:9.3_0: ‘How can I prevent my wealth from being taken by rulers or bandits, consumed by fire, swept away by flood, or taken by unloved heirs?’
ai-mn14:9.4_0: When they have spoken, the kings take it, or bandits take it, or fire consumes it, or flood.
ai-mn14:9.5_0: They sorrow and wail and lament, beating their breast and falling into confusion:
ai-mn14:9.7_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:10.1_0: Furthermore, for the sake of sensual pleasures kings fight with kings, aristocrats fight with aristocrats, brahmins fight with brahmins, and householders fight with householders. A mother fights with her child, child with mother, father with child, and child with father. Brother fights with brother, brother with sister, sister with brother, and friend fights with friend.
ai-mn14:10.2_0: Because they quarrels and foster each other with fists, stones, rods, and swords,
ai-mn14:10.3_0: resulting in death and deadly pain.
ai-mn14:10.4_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:11.1_0: Furthermore, for the sake of sensual pleasures they don their sword and shield, fasten their bow and arrows, and plunge into a battle massed on both sides, with arrows and spears flying and swords flashing.
ai-mn14:11.2_0: There you struck by spears, swords, arrows, and axes broke.
ai-mn14:11.3_0: resulting in death and deadly pain.
ai-mn14:11.4_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:12.1_0: Furthermore, for the sake of sensual pleasures they don their sword and shield, fasten their bow and arrows, and charge wetly plastered bastions, with arrows and spears flying and swords flashing.
ai-mn14:12.2_0: There they found no a spear, sword, spears, arrows, and axes; they throat, misses, and humble.
ai-mn14:12.3_0: resulting in death and deadly pain.
ai-mn14:12.4_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:13.1_0: Furthermore, for the sake of sensual pleasures they break into houses, plunder wealth, steal from isolated buildings, commit highway robbery, and commit adultery.
ai-mn14:13.2_0: Then the kings have them arrested the punishment, and subject them to various punishments—
ai-mn14:13.3_1: They cut off their hands and feet, both ears, nose, both ears and nose.
ai-mn14:13.3_2: They made a cat, water, or fire, airs, creatures, gods, the Chausterities, or the same way.
ai-mn14:13.4_0: resulting in death and deadly pain.
ai-mn14:13.5_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures apparent in this very life, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:14.1_0: Furthermore, for the sake of sensual pleasures, they conduct themselves badly by way of body, speech, and mind.
ai-mn14:14.2_0: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-mn14:14.3_0: This is a drawback of sensual pleasures to do with lives to come, a mass of suffering caused by sensual pleasures.
ai-mn14:15.1_0: Mahānāma, this one time I was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
ai-mn14:15.2_0: Now at that time several Jain ascetics on the slopes of Isigili at the Black Rock were constantly standing, refusing seats. And they felt painful, sharp, severe, acute feelings due to overexertion.
ai-mn14:16.1_0: Then in the late afternoon, I came out of retreat and went to the Black Rock to visit those Jain ascetics.
ai-mn14:16.1_1: They went up to them and said,
ai-mn14:16.2_0: ‘Reverends, why are you constantly standing, refusing seats, so that you suffer painful, sharp, severe, acute feelings due to overexertion?’
ai-mn14:17.1_0: When I said this, those Jain ascetics said to me,
ai-mn14:17.2_0: ‘Reverend, the Jain leader Nātaputta claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing, to know and see everything without exception, thus:
ai-mn14:17.3_0: “Knowledge and vision are constantly and continually present to me, while walking, standing, sleeping, and waking.”
ai-mn14:17.5_0: “O Jain ascetics, you have done bad deeds in a past life. Wear them away with these severe and grueling austerities.
ai-mn14:17.6_0: And when you refrain from such deeds in the present by way of body, speech, and mind, you’re not doing any bad deeds for the future.
ai-mn14:17.7_0: So, due to eliminating past deeds by mortification, and not doing any new deeds, there’s nothing to come up in the future.
ai-mn14:17.8_0: With nothing to come up in the future, deeds end. With the ending of deeds, suffering ends. With the ending of suffering, feeling ends. And with the ending of feeling, all suffering will have been worn away.”
ai-mn14:17.9_0: We like and accept this, and we are satisfied with it.’
ai-mn14:18.1_0: When they said this, I said to them,
ai-mn14:18.2_0: ‘But reverends, did you know these things?
ai-mn14:18.3_0: for sure that you existed in the past, and it is not the case that you didn’t exist?’
ai-mn14:18.5_0: ‘But reverends, did you know these things?
ai-mn14:18.6_0: for sure that you did bad deeds in the past?’
ai-mn14:18.8_0: ‘But reverends, did you know these things?
ai-mn14:18.11_0: ‘But reverends, did you know these things?
ai-mn14:18.12_0: how much suffering is worn away today, how much suffering or how much yesterday, and how much previously. And that’s worn away with is worn away.
ai-mn14:18.14_0: ‘But reverends, did you know these things?
ai-mn14:18.15_0: and giving up unskillful qualities in the present life?’
ai-mn14:19.1_0: ‘So it seems that you don’t know whether
ai-mn14:19.2_0: for sure that you existed in the past, and it is not the case that you didn’t know
ai-mn14:19.3_0: for sure that you did bad deeds in the past, not knowingly,
ai-mn14:19.4_0: They don’t know whether or not they have any bad deed,
ai-mn14:19.5_0: how much suffering is worn away or what’s suffering. And how much yesterday is worn away and worn away.
ai-mn14:19.7_0: and giving up unskillful qualities in the present life.
ai-mn14:19.8_0: That being so, when those in the world who are violent and bloody-handed and make their living by cruelty are reborn among humans they go forth as Jain ascetics.’
ai-mn14:20.1_0: ‘Reverend Gotama, pleasure is not gained through pleasure; pleasure is gained through pain.
ai-mn14:20.2_0: For if pleasure were to be gained through pleasure, King Seniya Bimbisāra of Māgadha would gain pleasure, since he lives in greater pleasure than Venerable Gotama.’
ai-mn14:20.3_0: ‘Clearly the venerables have spoken rashly, without reflection.
ai-mn14:20.4_0: “Reverend Gotama, pleasure is not gained through pleasure; pleasure is gained through pain.
ai-mn14:20.5_0: For if pleasure were to be gained through pleasure, King Seniya Bimbisāra of Māgadha would gain pleasure, since he lives in greater pleasure than Venerable Gotama.”
ai-mn14:20.6_0: Rather, I’m the one who should be asked about
ai-mn14:20.7_0: who lives in greater pleasure, King Bimbisāra or Venerable Gotama?’
ai-mn14:20.8_0: ‘Clearly we spoke rashly and without reflection.
ai-mn14:20.9_0: For if pleasure were to be gained through pleasure, King Seniya Bimbisāra of Māgadha would gain pleasure, since he lives in greater pleasure than Venerable Gotama.
ai-mn14:20.10_0: But now I ask you to ask Master Gotama about this matter,
ai-mn14:20.11_0: who lives in greater pleasure, King Bimbisāra or Venerable Gotama?’
ai-mn14:21.1_0: ‘Well then, reverends, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
ai-mn14:21.3_0: Is King Bimbisāra capable of experiencing perfect happiness for seven days and nights without moving his body or speaking?’
ai-mn14:21.6_0: Is King Bimbisāra capable of experiencing perfect happiness for six days ...
ai-mn14:21.11_0: Let alone two days without moving your pleasure?’
ai-mn14:21.13_0: ‘But I am capable of experiencing perfect happiness for one day and night without moving my body or speaking.
ai-mn14:21.14_0: I am capable of experiencing perfect happiness for two days ...
ai-mn14:21.20_0: What do you think, reverends? This being so, who lives in greater pleasure, King Bimbisāra or I?’
ai-mn14:21.21_0: ‘This being so, Venerable Gotama lives in greater pleasure than King Bimbisāra.’”
ai-mn14:21.22_0: This is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn14:21.23_0: Satisfied, Mahānāma the Sakyan was happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn14:21.24_0: The fourth section on the Making of Suffering is finished.
